workflow.name: Facebook Token Retrieval & Management
workflow.description:
## Pre-Conditions
1. A Facebook Developer account with an active app.
2. Basic understanding of n8n workflows.
3. Access to a database (optional, for storing tokens).

## Setup
1. **Webhook Activation**:
   - Configure the Webhook to receive user requests and process input data.
   - Ensure the Webhook URL is correctly set in your Facebook App settings.

2. **Short-Lived Token Retrieval**:
   - Use **Facebook OAuth** to fetch a short-lived token from the authorization code.

3. **Long-Lived Token Conversion**:
   - Convert the short-lived token into a long-lived token (valid for ~60 days).

4. **Page Token Retrieval**:
   - Follow the provided instructions to retrieve **Page Tokens** for posting on managed Facebook Pages.

5. **Customizable Scopes**:
   - Edit the `correctScopes` array to include or exclude permissions as needed.

6. **Optional Database Storage**:
   - Extend the workflow to save tokens to a database instead of displaying them on-screen.

7. **Step-by-Step Instructions**:
   - Detailed guidance is provided via sticky notes for activating the app, configuring Webhook, and editing parameters like `fb_redirect_uri`, `app_id`, and `app_secret`.

## Who the Template is For
- **Developers**: Integrating Facebook APIs into their applications.
- **Social Media Managers**: Automating posting and engagement on Facebook Pages.
- **n8n Users**: Looking for a ready-to-use workflow for Facebook Token management.

## Primary Use
- Automates Facebook Token retrieval and management.
- Supports posting to Facebook Pages via **Page Tokens**.
- Easily customizable and extendable for specific requirements.

parameters.content:
### Instructions to Get a 2-Month Facebook Token
Run n8n with tunnel model - Or user: Ngrok, Cloudflare Tunnel

1. **Activate the App**:
   - Launch the app. In the top-right corner near the **Save** button, you will see a status button labeled **Inactive**.
   - Switch this button to **Active** (it will turn green) to activate the app.

2. **Access the Webhook URL**:
   - Visit the following URL (fb_redirect_uri):  
      https://localhost:5678/webhook/facebook-login?type=login

3. **Follow the Steps**:
   - Complete the on-screen instructions to finish the process.
   - Once done, you will receive a **Facebook Token** valid for **2 months (60 days)**.


### Instructions to Check Token Status and Get Page Token
1. **Check Token Status**:
   - Go to [Facebook Access Token Debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken/).
   - Paste your **User Token** into the debugger to view details such as expiration date, permissions, and token status.

2. **Get Page Token for Posting**:
   - A **User Token** only grants access to personal information. To post on a Page, you need a **Page Token**.
   - Send a GET request to the following endpoint (replace `{user-access-token}` with your User Token):
     ```
     GET https://graph.facebook.com/v21.0/me/accounts?access_token={user-access-token}
     ```
   - The response will include a list of Pages you manage along with their corresponding **Page Tokens**.

3. **Use the Page Token**:
   - Use the **Page Token** to perform actions such as posting, managing comments, or other tasks on the Page.

**Note**:
- Ensure the User Token has the necessary permissions like `pages_manage_posts`, `pages_read_engagement`, etc., to retrieve the Page Token.
- The Page Token will have the same expiration as the User Token (approximately 60 days) and can be renewed.


`https://github.com/luuhung93/n8n-json`

Edit:
 - fb_redirect_uri
 - app_id
 - app_secret















Go to the [Facebook App](https://developers.facebook.com/apps/).
    - Select **Facebook Login** from the left-hand menu.
    - Click on **Settings**.
    - In the **Valid OAuth Redirect URIs** section, add the URL (fb_redirect_uri): `https://localhost:5678/webhook/facebook-login`

### Guide to Editing `correctScopes`

1. **Add a Permission**:
   - Add the permission to the `correctScopes` array. For example:
     ```javascript
     const correctScopes = [
       'pages_manage_posts', // Existing permission
       'pages_messaging',    // New permission added
     ];
     ```

2. **Edit a Permission**:
   - Replace a permission in the `correctScopes` array. For example:
     ```javascript
     const correctScopes = [
       'pages_manage_posts', // Existing permission
       'pages_messaging',    // New permission replacing the old one
     ];
     ```

3. **Remove a Permission**:
   - Remove a permission from the `correctScopes` array. For example:
     ```javascript
     const correctScopes = [
       'pages_manage_posts', // Keep this permission
       // 'pages_messaging',  // Remove this permission
     ];
     ```

4. **View Available Permissions**:
   - Refer to the full list of permissions at [Facebook Permissions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/permissions/).

Simply edit the `correctScopes` array; no need to worry about other parts.
By default, the token will be displayed on the screen. However, you can add a `node` to save the token into your database.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
